meanings.definition: Using or characterized by strict control or harsh authority
meanings.sent1: The ironfisted ruler demanded obedience from all his subjects.
meanings.sent2: The ironfisted manager did not tolerate any excuses for tardiness.
meanings.sent3: The ironfisted teacher made sure all students followed the classroom rules.
meanings.sent4: Her ironfisted grip on the company's finances ensured its stability.
meanings.sent5: The ironfisted judge's verdict left no room for leniency.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a firm or unyielding grip
meanings.sent1: The ironfisted handshake of the farmer showed his strength.
meanings.sent2: The ironfisted toddler refused to let go of his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The ironfisted cat clung tightly to the top of the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her ironfisted hold on the rope helped her climb the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The ironfisted lock on the door kept intruders out.

meanings.definition: Exerting strong or forceful control over a situation or group
meanings.sent1: The ironfisted leader made all the decisions without consulting others.
meanings.sent2: The ironfisted coach pushed the team to their limits during practice.
meanings.sent3: The ironfisted chef dictated every step of the cooking process.
meanings.sent4: Her ironfisted approach to negotiations left no room for compromise.
meanings.sent5: The ironfisted general led his troops to victory against all odds.
